Containers.Channels.DeliveryAddress.Desc: You can also provide delivery instructions e.g. "Can be delivered to any service point of organisation X".

Containers.Cahnnels.VistingAddress.Title: Visiting address
Containers.Channels.VistingAddress.Stree: Enter the exact street name and property number in the designated fields. No space is required after the property number, but if the number is e.g. 10-12, only the first figures will be read (10 in this example) and used to find the coordinates on the map. You will see the coordinates when you save the information on this page.
Select at least one day of the week or Always open.
Normal service hours, days of the week
Service hours that exceed 24-hour period, date from
Service hours that exceed 24-hour periods, day from
Service hours that exceed 24-hour periods, time from
Service hours that exceed 24-hour periods, date until
Service hours that exceed 24-hour periods, day until
Service hours that exceed 24-hour periods, time until

You can enter the normal operating hours for each day or select the option "Always open". You can also enter the service hours for a specific period of time. For example, if the service hours are shorter in the summer months, you can enter the dates and hours of this period and specify the information with a separate heading "Service hours in summer".
For example, out-of-hours services that may extend even over several 24-hour periods, can be defined under service hours exceeding 24-hour periods (Fri 20.00 - Mon 07.00).

Preview provides a summary of all service hours you have entered. Select the days of the week and hours and you will see the preview once you have added information. If the service hours are valid for a specific period of time, select "Valid between dates".
Select the days of the week and times and you will see the preview once you have added information.
If the service hours are valid for a specific period of time, select "Valid between dates".
Select the days of the week and times and you will see the preview once you have added information.
If the service hours are valid for a specific period of time, select "Valid between dates".
Select the days of the week and times and you will see the preview once you have added information.
If the service hours are valid for a specific period of time, select "Valid between dates".

For example, if the service channel is closed for public holidays, enter this information in the exceptional service hours field. Exceptional service hours are particularly suitable for short exceptions to normal operating hours. If the change in the service hours is of a longer duration, for example in the summer period, preferably provide this information under the normal service hours.
Closed for the entire period of time.

Select one or more hospital districts
Container.ChannelAttachmentContainer.Nam: Enter a clear name for the connection.
Containers.Channels.ConnectionType.Warni: You are changing an interoperable channel to be used by your own organisation only.
When you change an interoperable channel to be used by your own organisation only, other organisations can no longer connect to this channel. Any connections created earlier will also be removed.
Channel.Organization.TranslationMissing: Organisation must be described in the same language as the service channel information is given.
Containers.Channels.AddElectronicChannel: Add a service channel: online service
You can add a new online service channel on this page. Online services refer to a service channel where customers can use e-services.
Containers.Channels.ViewElectronicChanne: You can view, edit and publish information on the online service channel on this page.
Containers.Channels.ElectronicChannel.De: Are you sure you want to archive the online service channel?
Containers.Channels.ElectronicChannel.Wi: Are you sure you want to revert the online service channel to draft status?
Containers.Channels.ElectronicChannel.Re: Are you sure you want to restore the web service from the archive?
Containers.Channels.AddElectronicChannel: Does the online service require electronic identification?

Select yes or no from the drop-down menu depending on whether the online service requires identification or not. Identification refers to any method that users must use to log in or identify themselves in the online service.
Does the online service require an electronic signature?

Some instances of online service use require an electronic signature before submission. Select yes or no from the drop-down menu depending on whether the online service requires electronic signature or not. If the online service requires an electronic signature, select the number of required electronic signatures from the drop-down menu. Several signatures are required in some instances of service use in which the data must be confirmed by more than one person.
Containers.Channels.ElectronicChannel.Ca: Are you sure you want to abort? You will lose unsaved content.
Containers.Channels.AddElectronicChannel: Enter the exact web address for accessing the online service rather than, for example, the home page of your organisation’s online services. Make sure that the web address begins with http:// or https://.
Enter the exact web address, beginning with http:// or https://.
The web address could not be found, check the format.
Enter the name of the online service channel.
Select the organisation or sub-organisation responsible for the web service channel from the drop-down menu. The default option is your own organisation.

Write a summary providing a short description of the most central content of the online service channel. The summary will be displayed in the search results and it will help search engines find the service channel.
Write a short summary for search engines.

Describe the online service channel as clearly and comprehensibly for the customer as possible. Explain what the online service channel contains and how it works. Use clear standard language, avoid administrative terms. Only describe the online service channel, not the service connected to it, or the organisation providing the service or its tasks!
Write a clear and comprehensible description.

If support is available for users of the online service, enter the telephone number of the support service in this field. Enter the telephone number without the initial zero. Do not type the general telephone numbers of the organisation, such as the exchange number, in this field. If no user support is available, leave this field blank.

If support is available for users of the online service, enter the telephone number of the support service in this field. Enter the telephone number in the international format: "first enter the country code and then the telephone number without the initial zero. Do not type the general telephone numbers of the organisation, such as the exchange number, in this field. If no user support is available, leave this field blank.

The first option means normal call"pricing". Only select "free of charge" if the calls are completely free for the caller. If the call fee is composed in some other way, select "other fee" and enter the details in the text field. You can also provide other more specific price information in this text field.
Local network fee, mobile network fee, international fee
e.g. a normal call fee is charged for waiting time.
Explain the charges the call may incur
Where necessary, provide additional information about the telephone number to specify what the number is for.

Type in the name of the country and select the country code form the list. If the telephone number is a Finnish service number that cannot be called from abroad, check mark the information below the dialling code.
Service number that cannot be called from abroad.
Attachments and links to additional information

You can enter links to documents or pages that provide instructions related to the online service channel. The attachment should be located at an external web address, as no attachment files can be uploaded or saved in the Finnish Service Catalogue. Enter a clear name that describes the attachment, a more specific description where necessary and a link to the attachment.
Enter the exact web address in which the file or website will open. Make sure that the web address begins with http:// or https://.
Enter the exact web address, beginning with http:// or https://.
The web address could not be found, check the format.

You can enter the normal operating hours for each day or select the option "Always open". You can also enter the service hours for a specific period of time. For example, if the service hours are shorter in the summer months, you can enter the dates and hours of this period and specify the information with a separate heading "Service hours in summer".
For example, out-of-hours services that may extend even over several 24-hour periods, can be defined under service hours exceeding 24-hour periods (Fri 20.00 - Mon 07.00).

The preview will show you a summary of all service hours that you have entered. Select the days of the week and hours and you will see the preview once you have added information. If the service hours are valid for a specific period of time, select "Valid between dates".
Select the days of the week and times and you will see the preview once you have added information.
If service hours are valid for a specific period of time, select "Valid between dates".

For example, if the service channel is closed for public holidays, enter this information in the exceptional service hours field. Exceptional service hours are particularly suitable for short exceptions to normal operating hours. If the change in the service hours is of a longer duration, for example in the summer period, preferably provide this information under the normal service hours.
Closed for the entire period of time
Containers.Channels.ElectronicChannel.In: Area in which the online service is available.

Define the area in which the online service is available. Enter area information only when the area of the channel is different from the area information concerning the service. Consider your choice from the perspective of the end customer - area information is meant to help the end customer to find the channels available in his or her area. Select "nationwide" only when this online service is meant to cover the whole country. When the online service is available in a limited area, you can restrict the area by municipality, region (province), hospital district or sub-regional unit for business services. You can select several of these options at the same time.
Containers.Channels.AddPhoneChannel.Head: Add a service channel: telephone service
View and edit: telephone service
Containers.Channels.AddPhoneChannel.Desc: You can add a new telephone service channel on this page. Through the telephone service, users can get additional information about the service and take care of matters related to the service process. There are three kinds of telephone service channels: a call, a text message and a fax.
Containers.Channels.ViewPhoneChannel.Des: You can view, edit and publish the details of the telephone service channel on this page.
Are you sure you want to archive the telephone service channel?
Containers.Channels.PhoneChannel.Withdra: Are you sure you want to revert the telephone service channel to draft status?
Containers.Channels.PhoneChannel.Restore: Are you sure you want to restore the telephone service channel from the archive?
Are you sure you want to abort? You will lose unsaved content.
Containers.Channels.AddPhoneChannel.Step: Enter the name of the telephone service channel.
Select the organisation or sub-organisation that is responsible for the telephone service channel from the drop-down menu. The default option is your own organisation.

Write a summary providing a short description of the central content of the telephone service channel. The summary will be displayed in the search results and it will help search engines find the service channel.
Write a short summary for search engines.

Describe the content of the telephone service channel as clearly and comprehensibly for the customer as possible. Describe the aspects on which the telephone service channel offers additional information and how it can be used. Use clear standard language, avoid administrative terms. Only describe the telephone service, not the organisation that provides the service or its tasks!
Write a clear and comprehensible description.
Languages in which the telephone service is available
Select and enter the languages in which the telephone service is provided for the customer. Start typing the name of a language. A list will be displayed in which you can select the languages.
Type in the names of the languages and select the languages for the telephone service form the list.

If the telephone service has a dedicated website where additional information on the telephone service channel and its use is available, enter its web address here. Make sure that the web address begins with http:// or https://.
Enter the exact web address, beginning with http:// or https://.
The web address could not be found, check the format.

If support is available by e-mail for users of the telephone service, enter the e-mail address of the support service in this field. Do not type the general e-mail addresses of the organisation, such as the records office address, in this field. If no user support is available, leave this field blank.
Enter the telephone number without the initial zero. If the number cannot be called from abroad, enter the number also with the initial zero.

The first option means normal call"pricing". Only select "free of charge" if the calls are completely free for the caller. If the call fee is composed in some other way, select "other fee" and enter the details in the text field. You can also provide other more specific price information in this text field.
Local network fee, mobile network fee, international fee
Other fee, enter more specific details
e.g. normal call fee is charged for waiting time.
Explain the charges the call may incur
Where necessary, provide additional information about the telephone number to specify what the number is for.

Type in the name of the country and select the country code from the list. If the telephone number is a Finnish service number that cannot be called from abroad, check mark the information below the dialling code.
The types of telephone service channel are a call, a text message and a fax. Select the channel type according to the purpose of the telephone number.
Service number that cannot be called from abroad.

You can enter the normal operating hours for each day or select the option "Always open". You can also enter the service hours for a specific period of time. For example, if the service hours are shorter in the summer months, you can enter the dates and hours of this period and specify the information with a separate heading "Service hours in summer".
For example, out-of-hours services that may extend even over several 24-hour periods, can be defined under service hours exceeding 24-hour periods (Fri 20.00 - Mon 07.00).

The preview will show you a summary of all service hours that you have entered. Select the days of the week and hours and you will see the preview once you have added information. If the service hours are valid for a specific period of time, select "Valid between dates".
Containers.Channels.PhoneChannel.Informa: Area in which the telephone service is available.

Define the area in which the telephone service is available. Enter area information only when the area of the channel is different from the area information concerning the service. Consider your choice from the perspective of the end customer - area information is meant to help the end customer to find the channels available in his or her area. Select "nationwide" only when this telephone service is meant to cover the whole country. When the telephone service is available in a limited area, you can restrict the area by municipality, region (province), hospital district or sub-regional unit for business services. You can select several of these options at the same time.
Containers.Channels.AddPrintableFormChan: Add a service channel: printable form
View and edit: printable form
You can add a new printable form on this page. A printable form is a form in file format that is provided with a web address to a file in the organisation’s own server.
Containers.Channels.ViewPrintableFormCha: You can view, edit and publish the information about the printable from on this page.
Containers.Channels.AddPrintableFormChan: User support
Containers.Channels.PrintableFormChannel: Are you sure you want to archive the printable form?
Are you sure you want to revert the printable form to draft status?
Are you sure you want to restore the printable form from the archive?

The attachment should be located at an external web address, as no attachment files can be uploaded or saved in the Finnish Service Catalogue. Enter a clear name that describes the attachment, a more specific description where necessary and a link to the attachment.

Containers.Channels.AddPrintableFormChan: Name
Enter the "name" of the printable form.
Organisation
Select the organisation or sub-organisation responsible for the printable form from the drop-down menu. The default option is your own organisation.
Summary
Write a summary providing a short description of the printable form. The summary will be displayed in the search results and it will help search engines find the form.
Write a short summary for search engines.
Description

Describe the content of the printable form as clearly and comprehensibly for the customer as possible. Explain what kind of matters can be taken care of by using this form. Use clear standard language, avoid administrative terms. Only describe the printable form, not the organisation that provides the service or its tasks!
Write a clear and comprehensible description.
Form ID
If a unique form ID is used for the printable form, type it in here. If the form does not have an ID, leave the field blank.
Enter the form ID where necessary.
E-mail address

If support is available by e-mail for users of the printable form, enter the e-mail address of the support service in this field. Do not type the general e-mail addresses of the organisation, such as the records office address, in this field. If no user support is available, leave this field blank.
e.g. customersupport@organisation.fi
Telephone number

If support is available by phone for users of the printable form, enter the telephone number of the support service in this field. Enter the telephone number without the initial zero. Do not type the general telephone numbers of the organisation, such as the exchange number, in this field. If no user support is available, leave this field blank.
Information on call prices

The first option means normal call "pricing". Only select "free of charge" if the calls are completely free for the caller. If the call fee is composed in some other way, select "other fee" and enter the details in the text field. You can also provide other more specific price information in this text field.
Local network fee, mobile network fee, international fee
Free of charge
Other fee, enter more specific details:
Call price information
e.g. a normal call fee is charged for waiting time.
Explain the charges the call may incur
Additional information
Where necessary, provide additional information about the telephone number to specify what the number is for.
e.g. Customer support
Country code

Name
Give the website an informative name.

Web address

Containers.Channels.PrintableFormChannel: The area in which the printable form can be used

Define the area in which the printable form can be used. Enter area information only when the area of the channel is different from the area information concerning the service. Consider your choice from the perspective of the end customer - area information is meant to help the end customer to find the channels available in his or her area. Select "nationwide" only when this form is meant to cover the whole country. When the form is available in a limited area, you can restrict the area by municipality, region (province), hospital district or sub-regional unit for business services. You can select several of these options at the same time.
Containers.Channels.AddLocationChannel.H: Add a service channel: service location
Containers.Channels.AddLocationChannel.D: You can add a new service location on this page. A service location is a service channel in which you can use services or initiate service use. A service location is always a physical location that has an address or other location data.
You can view, edit and publish information about the service location on this page.
Containers.Channels.AddLocationChannel.S: The service location was saved successfully.
Containers.Channels.LocationChannel.Dele: Are you sure you want to archive the service location?
Containers.Channels.LocationChannel.With: Are you sure you want to revert the service location to draft status?
Containers.Channels.LocationChannel.Rest: Are you sure you want to restore the service location from the archive?
Containers.Channels.LocationChannel.Canc: Are you sure you want to abort? You will lose unsaved content.
Containers.Channels.AddServiceLocationCh: Enter the name of the service location.
Select the organisation or sub-organisation that is responsible for the service location from the drop-down menu. The default option is your own organisation.
Write a summary providing a short description of the service location. The summary is displayed in the search results and it helps search engines find the service.
Write a short summary for search engines.

Describe the service location as clearly and comprehensibly for the customer as possible. Describe in general terms the services that the service location provides. Use clear standard language, avoid administrative terms. Only describe the service location, not the organisation that provides the service or its tasks!
Write a clear and comprehensible description.

If the service location only serves the residents of certain municipalities or a clearly defined operating area has been specified for it, select Yes. An example of a service location of this type is a district court. The default option in the user interface is No.
If the operating area of the service location is limited, define the municipalities it covers here. Type the name of the municipality you want in this field and select it from the list.
Containers.Channel.AddServiceLocationCha: Type in the name of the municipalities and select them from the list.
Containers.Channels.AddServiceLocationCh: Languages in which the service location provides service
Select the languages in which the service location servers customers here. Start typing the name of a language. A list will be displayed in which you can select the languages.
Type in the names of the languages and select them from the list.

You can enter the normal operating hours for each day or select the option "Always open". You can also enter the service hours for a specific period of time. For example, if the service hours are shorter in the summer months, you can enter the dates and hours of this period and specify the information with a separate heading "Service hours in summer".
For example, out-of-hours services that may extend even over several 24-hour periods, can be defined under service hours exceeding 24-hour periods (Fri 20.00 - Mon 07.00).

Containers.Channels.ServiceLocationChann: Area served by the service location

Define the area served by the service location. Enter area information only when the area of the service location is different from the area information concerning the service. Consider your choice from the perspective of the end customer - area information is meant to help the end customer to find the channels available in his or her area. Select "nationwide" only when matters related to the whole country can be taken care in the service location. When the service location only serves in matters regarding a certain area, you can restrict the area by municipality, region (province), hospital district or sub-regional unit for business services. You can select several of these options at the same time.
Containers.Channels.AddWebPageChannel.He: You can add a new website channel on this page. The website may act as a link to a certain page of the organisation’s website or, for example, to a chat service. A website is a channel which provides additional information and advice for starting to use a service but where you cannot initiate the service use process or the processing of a matter.
Containers.Channels.ViewWebPageChannel.H: You can view, edit and publish the information about the website channel on this page.
Containers.Channels.AddWebPageChannel.St: Basic information
Basic information
User support

Select the languages in which the website is provided for customers here. Start typing the name of a language. A list will be displayed in which you can select the languages.

Enter the name of the website channel.
Organisation

Write a short summary for search engines.
Description

Describe the content of the website as clearly and comprehensibly for the customer as possible. Describe the aspect on which the website offers additional information and how it can be used (in particular if it contains a demo or a chat or remote service). Use clear standard language, avoid administrative terms. Only describe the website channel, not the organisation that provides the service or its tasks!
Write a clear and comprehensible description.
E-mail address

If support is available by e-mail for users of the website channel, enter the e-mail address of the support service in this field. Do not type the general e-mail addresses of the organisation, such as the records office address, in this field. If no user support is available, leave this field blank.
e.g. customersupport@organisation.fi
Telephone number

If support is available by phone for users of the website channel, enter the telephone number of the support service in this field. Enter the telephone number without the initial zero. Do not type the general telephone numbers of the organisation, such as the exchange number, in this field. If no user support is available, leave this field blank.
Information on call prices

The first option means normal call pricing. Only select "free of charge" if the calls are completely free for the caller. If the call fee is composed in some other way, select "other fee" and enter the details in the text field. You can also provide other more specific price information in this text field.
Local network fee, mobile network fee, international fee
Free of charge
Other fee, enter more specific details
Call price information
e.g. a normal call fee is charged for waiting time.
Explain the charges the call may incur
Additional information
Where necessary, provide additional information about the telephone number to specify what the number is for.
e.g. Customer support
Country code

Type in the name of the country and select the country code from the list. If the telephone number is a Finnish service number that cannot be called from abroad, check mark the information below the dialling code.
Service number that cannot be called from abroad.
Web address
Enter the exact web address in which website will open. Make sure that the web address begins with http:// or https://.
Enter the exact web address, beginning with http:// or https://.
Test the address
The web address could not be found, check the format.

Delivery instructions
You can also provide delivery instructions e.g. "Can be delivered to any service point of organisation X".
Enter delivery instructions
Coordinates for the location based on the address: {latitude}, {longitude}
The address you entered was not found.

AddressContainer.OpenMap.Info: If the visiting address does not show the exact location of the entrance, you can move the point to the right location on the map.
AddressContainer.OpenMap.AddressNotValid: Fill in at least: street name and postal code.

Containers.Services.AddService.Step2.Key: Add freely assigned keywords after careful consideration.

If the service does not target a specific sub-group, rather than selecting all lower-level target groups, skip the lower-level selections. If you have used a general description for the service, the target groups of the general description will already appear in the field. You can add target groups where necessary.

Containers.GeneralDescription.Name.Title: Name

Containers.GeneralDescription.Name.Toolt: Enter a customer-oriented name that describes the service of the general description.
Containers.GeneralDescription.Cancel.Tex: Are you sure you want to abort? You will lose unsaved content.
Containers.GeneralDescription.Delete.Tex: Are you sure you want to unconnect the general description? You will lose the description texts coming from the general description. Classification like target group, service class and keyword will remain in the service data.

Containers.GeneralDescription.ServiceTyp: Service type
The service types that can be recorded in the Finnish Service Catalogue are a service, a permit or other obligation, or a professional qualification.
Containers.GeneralDescription.ChargeType: Select whether the service is chargeable or free of charge. You can provide a more detailed description of the fees in the text field Additional information on fees.
Information on the price of the service
Containers.GeneralDescription.ServiceTyp: Additional information related to the permit or other obligation
Deadline
Enter information related to the deadline.

Explain briefly if the licence must be applied for by a certain deadline. For example, The licence must be applied for non later than four (4) weeks before the operation starts or an essential change is made in it.
Processing time
Enter information related to the processing time.

Provide a brief description of how long it will take the authorities to process the matter. For example, The permit application will be processed within six (6) months from receiving the application or, if the application is defective, from the date the applicant has provided the documents and reports required to resolve the matter.
Period of validity
Enter information related to the period of validity.
Provide a short description of how long the permit or obligation will be valid. For example, "The licence is valid for three (3) years." or "The permit is valid until further notice".
Additional information related to the professional qualification
Deadline
Enter information related to the deadline.
Explain briefly if there is a certain deadline for applying or getting this professional qualification.
Processing time
Enter information related to the processing time.
Provide a brief description of how long it will take the authorities to process the matter.
Period of validity
Enter information related to the period of validity.
Provide a short description of how long the licence for this professional qualification will be valid.
Containers.GeneralDescription.ShortDescr: Write a short summary for search engines.
Write a summary providing a short description of the central content of the service. The summary is displayed in the search results and it helps search engines find the service.
Containers.GeneralDescription.Descriptio: Provide a main description of the service.
Main description is a text that is always shown before the description text of the service.
Containers.GeneralDescription.ConditionO: Explain briefly if there are any conditions, prerequisites or criteria related to the service. Provide information only if it is clearly given in legislation or the information is always the same nationwide.
Explain briefly if there are any conditions, prerequisites or criteria for obtaining the permit.
If the user can only use the service under certain preconditions, explain these prerequisites, conditions and criteria.
Containers.GeneralDescription.ServiceUse: If a certain procedure is required for obtaining the service, provide the instructions in this field.
If using the service or applying for the benefit requires a certain order of actions or a specific procedure, describe it here in as much detail as possible.
Containers.GeneralDescription.Descriptio: Fill in a main description or a background description. At least one of them is mandatory.
Containers.GeneralDescription.ServiceCla: A service class based on the subject area is selected for the service. Select at least one service class that is as accurate as possible.
Select at least one service class.
Containers.GeneralDescription.OntologyTe: To describe the substance of the service, use keywords, or ontology concepts, that make services easier to find. Enter a word that describes the substance of the service as accurately as possible and select the most accurate concept among the options offered by the predictive input function. Select at least one and at most ten concepts to describe the service.

The service suggests keywords based on the content you have entered. Search for suggested keywords automatically using the Search for keywords button or pick the words you want from the list of keywords yourself.
Search for suggested keywords has been disabled until further notice.

Containers.GeneralDescription.TargetGrou: The service is classified according to the target group. The target group for which the service is intended should be selected. Select at least one main-level target group and specify it with a sub-group where necessary. If the service does not target a specific sub-group, rather than selecting all lower-level target groups, skip the lower-level selections.
Select at least one target group.
Search for and attach a general description
Containers.Manage.GeneralDescriptions.Co:
The Finnish Service Catalogue already contains some general descriptions for services. A general description describes a service provided by several organisations at a general level. If you cannot find a suitable general description, skip adding it.

A general description is an entity that contains the name of the service, textual content, and classifications and key words. When you have connected the general description to the service, you can view the general description data on the service page. If necessary, you can change the name of the service. In addition to the general description data, also the local information regarding the service must be provided.

Search for general descriptions using one or several search criteria, select the row you want and click on Select general description.
Containers.Manage.GeneralDescriptions.Se:
The Finnish Service Catalogue already contains some general descriptions for services. A general description describes a service provided by several organisations at a general level.

A general description is an entity that contains the name of the service, textual content, and classifications and key words. A general description can be attached to a service in the Services section.

You can search for and view the provided general descriptions in this section. Search general descriptions using one or several search criteria.
Search using the name of the general description

You can search for general descriptions according to the service class. The service class is a hashtag that can be used to group and find general descriptions. A general description may belong to several different classes. Select the service class you want from the drop-down menu.

You can search for general descriptions according to the target group. Select the principal target group from the drop-down menu and, where necessary, specify the target group by selecting a sub-group.

Containers.Manage.Organizations.Manage.S: Type in the organisation’s general e-mail address, for example the address of the records office or customer service. To enter several e-mail addresses, click on the Add link.

If necessary, you can enter additional information for the e-mail address to specify the unit of your organisation to which the message is sent. However, no additional information is needed if the address itself is clear and informative, for example records@agency.fi.
Enter the telephone number without the initial zero. If the number cannot be called from abroad, enter the number also with the initial zero.

The first option means normal call pricing. Only select "free of charge" if the calls are completely free for the caller. If the call fee is composed in some other way, select "other fee" and enter the details in the text field. You can also provide other more specific price information in this text field.
Local network fee, mobile network fee, international fee
Other fee, enter more specific details
e.g. a normal call fee is charged for waiting time.
Explain the charges the call may incur
Where necessary, provide additional information about the telephone number to specify what the number is for. For example, switchboard or customer service.

Type in the name of the country and select the country code from the list. If the telephone number is a Finnish service number that cannot be called from abroad, check mark the information below the dialling code.
Service number that cannot be called from abroad.
Give the organisation’s website an informative name.
Enter the name of the website.
Select the file format of the form from the drop-down menu. If the same form is offered in several file formats, enter each format separately.
Enter the exact web address in which website will open. Make sure that the web address begins with http:// or https://. To enter several websites, click on the Add link.

Select the organisation under which the sub-organisation will be added.

If the organisation type is a municipality, type in the name and select the municipality from the list.
Enter the name of the organisation or sub-organisation.
Where necessary, enter the alternative name of the organisation.

If the organisation has an alternative name, for example an abbreviation, enter it here. If you would like this name to be used as the primary name in connection with the organisation’s services, tick "Primary name".

Enter your organisation's Business ID in this field. If you cannot remember it, you can find it in the Business Information System (BIS, www.ytj.fi). Also check the practice followed by your organisation regarding the use of the business ID: some organisations have a single, shared business ID, whereas in others, sub-organisations have their own business IDs. Make sure you enter the correct business ID for the sub-organisation.
Enter the business ID in the correct form, e.g. 1234567-8.
If your organisation or sector uses the OID organisation classification (used e.g. in the social and health care sector), type in the organisation ID, or OID, specified in this classification system.
Enter the OID if your organisation uses it.
Write a clear and comprehensible description.

Write a short, user-friendly description of the organisation. Describe the organisation or sub-organisation, and what does it do from the perspective of a customer using its services. Rather than advertising the organisation, provide a neutral description of its core task.
Area in which the organisation primarily provides services*

Select the area in which the organisation primarily provides services. The area selected for the organisation will appear in services created for the organisation, but you can change and specify the selected areas in each service if necessary.

Containers.ServiceAndChannelRelations.Se: You can add, view or edit connections between services and service channels in this section. Containers.ServiceAndChannels.ServiceSea: You can search services by name.
Select the organisation or organisation level you need from the drop-down menu.

You can search for services by service class. The service class is a hashtag that can be used to group and find services. A service may belong to several different classes. Select the service class you want from the drop-down menu.
You can search for services by using keywords, or ontology concepts. When searching by a keyword, the search only returns the services in which the relevant keyword is used.
You can search services that are in draft status or have been published. Services in draft status are only visible to administrators in the Finnish Service Catalogue.
There are more search results than it is possible to show here. Please specify search criteria.

In the Services section, you can add new services and connect service channels to them, and edit the existing services of your organisation. Create a new service by clicking on Add service or search for services using one or several search criteria and choose the desired row for editing.
The service types that can be recorded in the Finnish Service Catalogue are a service, a permit or other obligation, or a professional qualification. You can restrict the search by type.

Containers.Services.AddService.Step1.Ser: Service type
The service types that can be recorded in the Finnish Service Catalogue are a service, a permit or other obligation, or professional qualification.
Containers.Services.AddService.Step1.Cha: Select whether the service is chargeable or free of charge. You can provide a more detailed description of the fees in the text field Additional information on fees.
Information on the price of the service
Containers.Services.AddService.Step1.Ava: Languages in which the service is available
Type in the languages in which the service is provided and select them from the list.
Select the languages in which the service is offered to the customer. Start typing the name of a language. A list will be displayed in which you can select the languages.
Containers.Services.AddService.ServiceCo: Area in which the service is available

Define the area in which the service is available. Consider the selection from the point of view of the end customer - area information is intended to help the end customer find the services in his or her area. Select "nationwide" only when this service is meant to cover the whole country. If the service is available in a limited area, you can restrict the area by municipality, region (province), hospital district or sub-regional unit for business services. You can select several of these options at the same time.
Containers.Services.AddService.Municipal: Select a municipality in which the service is available.
Type in the name of the municipality and select from the list.
Containers.Services.AddService.Step1.Ser: Additional information related to the permit or other obligation
Deadline
Enter information related to the deadline.

Explain briefly if the licence must be applied for by a certain deadline. For example, The licence must be applied for non later than four (4) weeks before the operation starts or an essential change is made in it.
Processing time
Enter information related to the processing time.

Provide a brief description of how long it will take the authorities to process the matter. For example, The licence application will be processed within six (6) months from receiving the application or, if the application is defective, from the date the applicant has provided the documents and reports required to resolve the matter.
Period of validity
Enter information related to the period of validity.
Provide a short description of how long the licence or obligation will be valid. For example, The licence is valid for three (3) years. /The licence is valid until further notice.
Additional information related to the professional qualification
Deadline
Enter information related to the deadline.
Explain briefly if there is a certain deadline for applying or getting this professional qualification.
Processing time
Enter information related to the processing time.
Provide a brief description of how long it will take the authorities to process the matter.
Period of validity
Enter information related to the period of validity.
Provide a short description of how long the licence for this professional qualification will be valid.
Connecting a general description to the service

The general description of the service is a service description that applies generally and nationwide. Select whether you want to connect a general description to your service. When the general description is connected, the information in it will be shown as part of the service information.
Enter a description in this field in which you specify the information provided in the general description.
Containers.Services.AddService.Step1.Gen: Search for and connect a general description
Containers.Services.ViewService.Step1.Co: A general description has been connected to the service
Containers.Services.AddService.Step1.Nam: Enter a customer-oriented name that describes the service.

Enter a name for the service that is as descriptive as possible. Do not include the name of the organisation in the name of the service. If you have used the general description for the service, only modify the name if it is absolutely necessary!
Containers.Services.AddService.Step1.Alt: Enter another name for the service where necessary.
Where necessary, enter another name that the user may use when searching for the service.
Containers.Services.AddService.Step1.Sho: Write a short summary for search engines.
Write a summary providing a short description of the central content of the service. The summary is displayed in the search results and it helps search engines find the service.
Containers.Services.AddService.Step1.Des: Provide a clear and comprehensible description of the service.

Describe the service as clearly and comprehensibly for the customer as possible. Explain what the service contains, how it is offered to the customer, what need it responds to and what its aims are. Use clear standard language, avoid administrative terms. Describe the service offered to the customer, not the organisation providing the service or its tasks! You can divide the text into paragraphs. If you have connected a general description to the service, use the description field to explain how the service described in the general description has been organised in your organisation/region/municipality and what its special features are. Do not repeat what has already been explained in the general description.
Containers.Services.AddService.Step1.Con: Explain briefly if there are any conditions, prerequisites or criteria related to the service.
Explain briefly if there are any conditions, prerequisites or criteria for obtaining the licence.
Explain briefly if there are any conditions, prerequisites or criteria for submitting a notification.
Explain briefly if there are any conditions, prerequisites or criteria for registration.

If the user can only use the service under certain preconditions, explain these prerequisites, conditions and criteria. For example, "The service is intended only for persons at risk of unemployment". Also, if certain information or documents are required for the successful use of the service, e.g. "The details of your income and taxes you have paid since the beginning of the year and an estimate of your income for the whole year are required for an adjustment to your tax card."
Containers.Services.AddService.Step1.Ser: User instructions
If a certain procedure is required for obtaining the service, provide the instructions in this field.

If using the service or applying for the benefit requires a certain order of actions or a specific procedure, describe it here in as much detail as possible. For example, if one of the service channels is the primary service channel, mention it here. For example, Web services are the primarily method of registration.
Containers.Services.AddService.Step1.Are: Area in which the service is available*

Define the area in which the service is available. Consider the selection from the point of view of the end customer - area information is intended to help the end customer find the services in his or her area. Select "nationwide" only when this service is meant to cover the whole country. If the service is available in a limited area, you can restrict the area by municipality, region (province), hospital district or sub-regional unit for business services. You can select several of these options at the same time.
Area information has been filled in automatically based on the responsible organisation. You can change or specify the selection.
Select one or more sub-regional units for business services

Containers.Services.AddService.Step3.Ser: Service provision method and the service provider

The service provider is the party that delivers the service to the customer in practice. First select the service provision method from the drop-down menu. If the provider is the same as the responsible organisation, select "self produced services" from the drop-down menu. In that case, the organisation you select as the responsible party will appear as the provider. If there are several responsible organisations, select each one of them separately. If the service is provided by another party to which the responsible party has outsourced it, select "procured services". An organisation directory will then be displayed, in which you can select the correct provider. If the information on the provider of an outsourced service cannot be found in the Finnish Service Catalogue, enter the provider’s name in the free-text field. If none of these options is suitable, select "Other". For example, if Ministry X provides a service by commission of Ministry Y, select "Other".

You have selected "self produced services" as the service provision method. The organisation you have selected as the responsible organisation will appear as service provider. If there are several responsible organisations, select each one of them separately.
Link to the information on services accepting service vouchers
Enter an exact web address in which the user will find a list of service providers. Make sure that the web address begins with http:// or https://.
If the organisation cannot be found in the Finnish Service Catalogue, you can add the name of the organisation as text.
The organisation cannot be found in the Finnish Service Catalogue. You can add the name of the organisation as text.
Enter the name of the organisation.
CurrentIssues.Header.CurrentIssues.Label: Latest notice
CurrentIssues.Header.CurrentIssues.Toolt: First write a date and time, then notice text in the languages needed.
CurrentIssues.Header.PreviousIssues.Labe: Earlier notice (shown only to system administrators)
Components.Button.Search.Title: Search
FrontPage.CommonSearchFields.Name.Title: Search term
FrontPage.CommonSearchFields.Name.Toolti: Enter the search term you want to use to search for content. For example, you can perform a search using the name or part of the name of the service or service channel.
FrontPage.SelectLanguage.Title: Language version
FrontPage.SelectLanguage.Tooltip: The search will return results in all language versions. You can remove the selected language by unchecking it.
FrontPage.OntologyTerms.Title: Keyword
FrontPage.OntologyTerms.Tooltip: You can search for services by using keywords, also called ontology concepts. When searching by a keyword, the search only returns the services in which the relevant keyword is used.
FrontPage.SelectOrganization.Title: Organisation
FrontPage.SelectOrganization.Tooltip: Select the organisation you want from the drop-down menu. The default option is your own organisation.
FrontPage.PublishingStatus.Title: Status
FrontPage.PublishingStatus.Tooltip: You can search services that are in draft status or have been published. Services in draft status are only visible to administrators in the service catalogue.
FrontPage.PublishingStatus.Draft.Title: Draft
FrontPage.PublishingStatus.Deleted.Title: Archived
FrontPage.ServiceClassCombo.Title: Service class
FrontPage.ServiceClassCombo.Tooltip: You can search for services according to service class. The service class is a hashtag that can be used to group and find services. A service may belong to several different classes. Select the service class you want from the drop-down menu.
FrontPage.ServiceTypes.Title: Service type
FrontPage.ServiceTypes.Tooltip: The service types that can be recorded in the Finnish Service Catalogue are a service, a licence and an obligation. You can also search by service type.
FrontPage.TargetGroups.Title: Principal target group
FrontPage.TargetGroups.Tooltip: You can search for general descriptions according to the target group. Select the principal target group from the drop-down menu and, where necessary, specify the target group by selecting a sub-group.
FrontPage.SearchContentSwitcher.Title: Content type
FrontPage.SearchContentSwitcher.Tooltip: Content types include all content recorded to the Finnish Service Catalogue: services, service channels and the information on the organisation.
FrontPage.SearchContentSwitcher.SeneralD: Can be connected to several services
FrontPage.ServiceTypeCell.Title: Services
FrontPage.Search.Title: Finnish Service Catalogue
FrontPage.Search.Description: You can describe the services of your organisation and connect the appropriate service channels in the Finnish Service Catalogue. You can also maintain general information about your organisation and the organisation hierarchy.
FrontPage.Navigation.Search.Title: Information content
FrontPage.Navigation.Relations.Title: CONNECTIONS
FrontPage.Buttons.AddNewContent.Title: Add new
FrontPage.Shared.Search.Header.Name: Name
FrontPage.GeneralDescription.Search.Head: Service class
